title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported project team. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: outlines propose change strapvizr. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/strapvizr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to strapvizr
text: Please note strapvizr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: How to use strapvizr
How to use strapvizr
text: using toy dataset mtcars demonstrate usage. dataset extracted 1974 Motor Trend US magazine, comprises fuel consumption 10 aspects automobile design performance 32 automobiles. use feature mpg demonstration purpose.

title: How to use strapvizr
text: two functions bootstrap module, bootstrapand calculate_boot_stats. two functions perform bootstrapping calculate relevant statistics.

title: How to use strapvizr
text: Functionality function performs bootstrap returns numeric vector result. Function inputs sample: data bootstrapped controls size outputted list default auto means distribution size original sample mean, median, var (.e. variance), sd (.e. standard deviation) seed: can set reproducibility

title: How to use strapvizr
text: Functionality function performs bootstrapping returns named list sampling distribution statistics. Function inputs sample : data bootstrapped controls size outputted list default auto means distribution size original sample value 0 1 mean, median, var (.e. variance), sd (.e. standard deviation) seed : can set reproducibility pass_dist : specifies sampling distribution returned function

title: How to use strapvizr
text: two functions display module, plot_ci tabulate_stats. use bootstrapping statistics create report-ready visualizations tables sampling distribution.

title: How to use strapvizr
text: Functionality function creates histogram sampling distribution confidence interval sample mean Function Inputs sample : data bootstrapped rep : number repetitions bootstrapping bin_size : number bins data split histogram mean, median, var (.e. variance), sd (.e. standard deviation) default auto means distribution size original sample value 0 1 seed : can set reproducibility title : title histogram y_axis : name y axis default NULL means plot saved
code: # Plot sampling distibution of 1000 sample means at a 95% confidence interval plot_1 <- strapvizr::plot_ci(ex_data, rep = 1000, level = 0.95, seed = 123) plot_1 # Plot sampling distibution of 1000 sample means at a 99% confidence interval # with a unique title and a bin size of 50 title <- "Bootstrapped miles/(US) gallon" plot_2 <- strapvizr::plot_ci(ex_data, rep = 1000, bin_size = 50, level = 0.99,                               title = title, seed = 123, estimator = "var") plot_2 class(plot_2) #> [1] "gg"     "ggplot"

title: How to use strapvizr
text: Functionality function creates list two tibble objects summarize sampling distribution parameters creating bootstrapped samples saves latex files. Function Inputs stat_list : summary statistics produced calculate_boot_stats() function many decimal places shown default NULL means tables saved
code: stat <- calculate_boot_stats(ex_data, 1000, level = 0.95, seed = 123) result  <-  strapvizr::tabulate_stats(stat, precision = 2) stats_table <- result[[1]] # stats table parameters_table <- result[[2]] # parameter table  stats_table #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   `Sample Mean` `Lower Bound CI` `Upper Bound CI` `Standard Error` #>           <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1          20.1             18.2             22.3             1.06 parameters_table #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   `Sample Size` Repetitons `Significance Level` #>           <int>      <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1            32       1000                 0.05 class(stats_table) #> [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame" class(parameters_table) #> [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

what: Package context within the R ecosystem
title: Bootstrapped Confidence Intervals, Plots, and More
text: package builds dplyr package ggplot2 package achieve mentioned functionalities. BootCI package seems streamline confidence interval process include plotting support. StrapvizR streamlines process bootstrapping data visualization embedding documents available single bundle. tutorials bootstrap confidence intervals sources (1), (2) (3) encourage reader plot results manually.

title: Bootstrapped Confidence Intervals, Plots, and More
text: bootstrap: Returns sampling distribution specified replicates generated specified estimator replacement given bootstrap sample size. calculate_boot_stats: Calculates confidence interval given sampling distribution well bootstrapped statistics. plot_ci: Creates histogram bootstrapped sampling distribution confidence interval observed sample statistic. tabulate_stats: Generates table contains given sampling distribution’s mean standard deviation along relevant statistics well summary table bootstrap distributions parameters. code automatically saves tables html documents.

Can NULL pass_dist boolean vector decide whether return bootstrapped distribution

title:
Makes two presentation-ready tables that summarize the statistics from the bootstrapped
samples and the parameters for creating the bootstrapped samples. — tabulate_stats

title:
Makes two presentation-ready tables that summarize the statistics from the bootstrapped
samples and the parameters for creating the bootstrapped samples. — tabulate_stats
code: st <- calculate_boot_stats(c(1, 2, 3, 4), 1000, level = 0.95, seed = 123) result  <-  tabulate_stats(st) result[[1]] # stats table #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   `Sample Mean` `Lower Bound CI` `Upper Bound CI` `Standard Error` #>           <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1           2.5              1.5              3.5             0.55 result[[2]] # parameter table #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   `Sample Size` Repetitons `Significance Level` #>           <int>      <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1             4       1000                 0.05
